page.title: 02TYPICAL HOUSING, BROMSGROVE
page.content: Most of our{houses} have brick walls and chimneys, wooden or metal door and window frames, doors and windows of glass or transparent plastic, iron or plastic rainwater pipes and gutters. Frames and fittings are often painted white,with doors in various colours: blue,red,green being popular.There are single-storey bungalows,three and four storey blocks of flats,many two-storey detached houses but mostly two-storey semi-detached,built during the 20th C. Some, older, are built in terraces of three or more. Most houses have small rectangular lawned {gardens,}front and rear, ofen enclosed by low hedges, brick walls or fences. Trees, shrubs, flowers, and vegetables are widely cultivated. Many houses have adjoining garages for the family {motor-car(s). Aerials, for TV reception, are fixed to the chimneys.
